The Senate passed a bill to keep federal: but without a provision to defund Obama's healthcare law.
The final measure passed with a 54: 42 margin, with two Republicans not voting. All 54 who voted for the measure were either Democrats or independents who caucus with the Democrats. All 42 who voted against the measure were Republicans.
No member of the Senate crossed party li: 4. The White House pointed to the preliminary vote to proceed to debate, known as a "cloture vote," as evidence of the Senate acting responsibly to keep the government open.
